str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.

word: to join me in my struggle
str2: To struggle in company with, aid. From sun and agonizomai; to struggle in company with, i.e. to be a partner.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
